playn.core

Class MouseImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • playn.core.MouseImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Mouse
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MouseStub

    public abstract class MouseImpl
extends Object
implements Mouse
    Handles the common logic for all platform Mouse implementations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface playn.core.Mouse

      boolean hasMouse()
      Returns true if the underlying platform supports mouse interaction.

      Returns true if mouse interaction is enabled, false if not.
      boolean isLocked()
      True if the mouse is locked.
      boolean isLockSupported()
      True if lock has a chance of success on this platform (the user may still block it, or detection may be broken for some browsers).
      Mouse.Listener listener()
      Returns the currently configured global mouse listener, or null.

      Lock the mouse, i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • hasMouse

        public boolean hasMouse()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Returns true if the underlying platform supports mouse interaction. If this method returns false, listeners may still be registered with this service but they will never be notified.
        Specified by:
        hasMouse in interface Mouse

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Returns true if mouse interaction is enabled, false if not. Interaction is enabled by default. See Mouse.setEnabled(boolean).
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Mouse

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Allows mouse interaction to be temporarily disabled. No mouse events will be dispatched whilst this big switch is in the off position.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface Mouse

      • listener

        public Mouse.Listener listener()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Returns the currently configured global mouse listener, or null.
        Specified by:
        listener in interface Mouse

      • setListener

        public void setListener(Mouse.Listener listener)
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Sets the listener that will receive mouse events. Setting the listener to null will cause mouse events to stop being fired.
        Specified by:
        setListener in interface Mouse

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Lock the mouse, i.e. receive mouse events even when the mouse pointer leaves the window.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface Mouse

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        Unlock the mouse.
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface Mouse

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        True if the mouse is locked.
        Specified by:
        isLocked in interface Mouse

      • isLockSupported

        public boolean isLockSupported()
        Description copied from interface: Mouse
        True if lock has a chance of success on this platform (the user may still block it, or detection may be broken for some browsers).
        Specified by:
        isLockSupported in interface Mouse
